title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0203

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Katherine, and today we have an elementary-level lesson for you all about computers.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们有一节关于计算机的初级课程。

segments.en: So we are going to take a look at some of the basic parts of a computer and also about bad programs that could affect your computer and make it not work.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看看计算机的一些基本部件，以及可能影响计算机并使其无法工作的坏程序。

segments.en: So before we get going, we have a verb for you that we're going to look at in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 在开始之前，我们有一个动词要在词汇预览中讨论。

segments.en: Alright, so today on Vocabulary Preview, we have a verb, as you said, and it's to crash.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的词汇预览中，我们有一个动词，就是崩溃。

segments.en: Okay, this has a couple of different meanings, but in today's dialogue, this means for your computer to shut down or to freeze or to stop working.
segments.cn: 好的，这有几种不同的意思，但在今天的对话中，这意味着你的计算机关闭、冻结或停止工作。

segments.en: Right, because maybe you heard of a car crash, right, when two cars, bam, hit each other.
segments.cn: 对，因为你可能听说过车祸，对吧，当两辆车，砰，撞在一起。

segments.en: In this case, your computer is just not working anymore.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你的计算机就是不再工作了。

segments.en: So my computer crashed is a way to say, my computer stopped working.
segments.cn: 所以“我的计算机崩溃了”就是在说“我的计算机停止工作”。

segments.en: Okay, so that's a word that we're going to listen in our dialogue today.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们今天在对话中要听到的一个词。

segments.en: Why don't we jump right into it, and we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 我们直接开始吧，稍后再见。

segments.en: Hello, thanks for calling 123 Tech Help.
segments.cn: 你好，感谢拨打123技术帮助热线。

segments.en: I turned on my laptop and it broke.
segments.cn: 我打开我的笔记本电脑，它坏了。

segments.en: I mean, the monitor went black.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，显示器变黑了。

segments.en: It sounds like you might have a virus.
No, your computer might have a virus.
segments.cn: 不，你的计算机可能有病毒。

segments.en: I mean, it has a bad program on it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它上面有一个坏程序。
也许这就是它崩溃的原因。

segments.en: I recommend that you run an anti-virus program in order to safely remove any unwanted spyware or Trojans.
segments.cn: 我建议你运行一个防病毒程序，以安全地删除任何不需要的间谍软件或木马。

segments.en: All right, so lots of great technology words today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天有很多很棒的科技词汇。

segments.en: Let's take a look at a few of them in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们在语言收获中看看其中的一些。

segments.en: All right, so let's start off with our first word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们从第一个词开始。

segments.en: You've probably heard it before, but let's go over it just in case.
segments.cn: 你可能以前听过，但我们再复习一下以防万一。

segments.en: A laptop is a kind of computer.
segments.cn: 笔记本电脑是一种计算机。
我们有台式机、笔记本电脑。

segments.en: So your lap is the top part of your legs.
segments.cn: 所以你的腿的上部是大腿。

segments.en: So a laptop computer is a small portable computer that you can take with you anywhere.
segments.cn: 所以笔记本电脑是一种小型便携式计算机，你可以随身携带。

segments.en: A lot of students have laptops and businessmen as well.
segments.cn: 很多学生和商人都有笔记本电脑。

segments.en: So you mentioned the opposite would be a desktop.
segments.cn: 你提到的相反的就是台式机。

segments.en: Right, so it sits on top of a desk.
Okay, so both a desktop and a laptop have monitors, a computer monitor.
segments.cn: 好的，台式机和笔记本电脑都有显示器，计算机显示器。

segments.en: So a monitor is like a TV for your computer.
segments.cn: 所以显示器就像是你计算机的电视。

segments.en: It's where you can see what you're doing.
segments.cn: 你可以看到你在做什么。

segments.en: Okay, so it's called a monitor or a screen maybe.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它叫做显示器或屏幕。

segments.en: You can also use the word screen, but monitor is the technical word for usually a box, like a TV that goes with the desktop computer.
segments.cn: 你也可以使用“屏幕”这个词，但显示器通常是与台式计算机配套的技术词。

segments.en: So Todd, the computer guy, said, Hey, I think your computer might have a virus.
segments.cn: 所以Todd，计算机专家说，嘿，我觉得你的计算机可能有病毒。

segments.en: So I guess you know what a virus is when you get sick, right?
segments.cn: 所以我想你知道生病时的病毒，对吧？

segments.en: You get the flu or the cold.
That's right, you can say, I have a virus.
segments.cn: 没错，你可以说，我有病毒。

segments.en: But how can a computer have a virus?
segments.cn: 但计算机怎么会有病毒呢？

segments.en: This means... It's a program that is designed to hurt your computer.
segments.cn: 这意味着……这是一个旨在伤害你的计算机的程序。

segments.en: All right, so it's like your computer is sick and it doesn't work.
segments.cn: 好的，所以就像你的计算机生病了，无法工作。

segments.en: So a virus might make your computer crash.
segments.cn: 所以病毒可能会使你的计算机崩溃。

segments.en: So in order to avoid this, what we need is an antivirus program.
segments.cn: 为了避免这种情况，我们需要一个防病毒程序。

segments.en: Okay, so virus is a bad thing.
An antivirus program is a program that protects your computer from viruses.
segments.cn: 防病毒程序是保护你的计算机免受病毒侵害的程序。

segments.en: You might have heard of a very famous program called Norton Antivirus or McAfee Antivirus.
segments.cn: 你可能听说过一个非常著名的程序叫做Norton Antivirus或McAfee Antivirus。

segments.en: So those are some of the main technical terms that we have on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以这些是我们在语言收获中提到的一些主要技术术语。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue quickly one sec... no.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不快速再听一遍我们的对话，然后再回到流利度提升。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue quickly again and we'll be back with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 你好，感谢拨打123技术帮助热线。

segments.en: Hello, thanks for calling 123 Tech Help.
I turned on my laptop and it broke.
segments.cn: 我打开我的笔记本电脑，它坏了。

segments.en: I mean, the monitor went black.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，显示器变黑了。

segments.en: It sounds like you might have a virus.
No, your computer might have a virus.
segments.cn: 不，你的电脑可能有病毒。

segments.en: I mean, it has a bad program on it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它上面有个坏程序。
也许这就是它崩溃的原因。

segments.en: I recommend that you run an antivirus program in order to safely remove any unwanted spyware or Trojans.
segments.cn: 我建议你运行一个杀毒程序，以安全地删除任何不需要的间谍软件或木马。

segments.en: So now let's start off with three key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们开始三个关键短语的流利构建。

segments.en: This first phrase is one that I know you use a lot.
segments.cn: 第一个短语是我知道你经常使用的。

segments.en: So now, depending on the tone, it can mean different things, right?
segments.cn: 所以现在，根据语气，它可以意味着不同的事情，对吧？

segments.en: So in this case, what does it mean?
segments.cn: 那么在这种情况下，它是什么意思？

segments.en: So the man who's having problems with his computer says, my computer.
segments.cn: 所以那个遇到电脑问题的人说，我的电脑。

segments.en: He seems a little bit anguished.
So you can say, oh man, my computer crashed.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，哦，天哪，我的电脑崩溃了。

segments.en: Now you can also say it for maybe surprise like, oh man.
segments.cn: 现在你也可以用它来表示惊讶，比如，哦，天哪。

segments.en: So when you're excited about something, oh man, this computer game is awesome.
segments.cn: 所以当你对某事感到兴奋时，哦，天哪，这个电脑游戏太棒了。

segments.en: So it's just a way of expressing maybe disappointment or in some cases excitement.
segments.cn: 所以这只是表达失望或在某些情况下兴奋的一种方式。

segments.en: So think about the way that you say it.
So now the guy, Todd, he tells him, hey, sir, it's okay.
segments.cn: 所以现在这个人，托德，他告诉他，嘿，先生，没关系。

segments.en: So this might be funny sounding because we say calm.
segments.cn: 所以这可能听起来有点好笑，因为我们说冷静。

segments.en: It's almost like you're so upset and you're standing up.
segments.cn: 几乎就像你非常生气并且站着。

segments.en: So you tell someone to calm down.
segments.cn: 所以你告诉某人冷静点。

segments.en: So you might hear a parent say about their child.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会听到父母对他们的孩子说。

segments.en: And now for our third phrase.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的第三个短语。

segments.en: So this is also an interjection and it's very, very, very common.
segments.cn: 所以这也是一个感叹词，非常非常常见。

segments.en: So you'll probably hear people when they're talking, they're like, oh, I went over there.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会听到人们在说话时，他们会说，哦，我去了那里。

segments.en: I mean, we went to this place.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我们去了这个地方。

segments.en: And usually we say this when we want to correct what we just said.
segments.cn: 通常我们在想要纠正我们刚才所说的内容时会说这个。

segments.en: For example, your computer might have a virus.
segments.cn: 例如，你的电脑可能有病毒。

segments.en: I mean, it has a bad program on it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它上面有个坏程序。

segments.en: So the computer support man, Todd, he understands maybe this person doesn't know what a virus is.
segments.cn: 所以电脑支持人员托德，他明白这个人可能不知道什么是病毒。

segments.en: So, I mean, he's changing what he just said.
segments.cn: 所以，我的意思是，他在改变他刚才所说的。

segments.en: We could say, oh, Saturday I'm going to the movies.
segments.cn: 我们可以说，哦，星期六我要去看电影。

segments.en: I mean, Sunday I'm going to the movies.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，星期天我要去看电影。

segments.en: What are you doing on Sunday?
So you use it to correct yourself or maybe further explain something because maybe you are talking about a topic and maybe the person is not understanding you so you want to make it more clear.
segments.cn: 所以你用它来纠正自己，或者进一步解释一些事情，因为也许你在谈论一个话题，而那个人可能不理解你，所以你想让它更清楚。

segments.en: Like, she was very angry at me.
I mean, of course she was because I did something wrong.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，当然她生气，因为我做错了事。

segments.en: So it's a way to offer an explanation.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种提供解释的方式。

segments.en: So try and use that one in your speech this week.
segments.cn: 所以这周试着在你的演讲中使用这个。

segments.en: It's a really, really great, common English phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常非常好的常用英语短语。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time and we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不最后一次听我们的对话，然后我们会回来再聊一聊。

segments.en: Can you help me on my computer?
segments.cn: 你能帮我解决我的电脑问题吗？

segments.en: I turned on my laptop and it broke.
segments.cn: 我打开我的笔记本电脑，它坏了。

segments.en: I mean, the monitor went black.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，显示器变黑了。

segments.en: It sounds like you might have a virus.
Your computer might have a virus.
I mean, it has a bad program on it.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它上面有一个坏程序。
也许这就是它崩溃的原因。

segments.en: I recommend that you run an antivirus program in order to safely remove any unwanted spyware or Trojans.
segments.cn: 我建议你运行一个杀毒程序，以安全地删除任何不需要的间谍软件或木马。

segments.en: So, Marco, in today's dialogue, we heard a couple of strange words about computer viruses.
segments.cn: 所以，马尔科，在今天的对话中，我们听到了几个关于电脑病毒的奇怪词汇。

segments.en: One of them you might be familiar with from Greek stories and fables.
segments.cn: 其中一个你可能在希腊故事和寓言中听说过。

segments.en: So it's a kind of bad software that will hurt your computer.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种会伤害你电脑的坏软件。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a type of virus that comes in and it's supposed to be a good program or not harm your computer.
segments.cn: 是的，它是一种病毒，伪装成一个好的程序，或者不会伤害你的电脑。

segments.en: But it's really just a lie.
segments.cn: 但这实际上只是一个谎言。

segments.en: It's disguised as something else and then it starts to really ruin your computer.
segments.cn: 它伪装成其他东西，然后开始真正破坏你的电脑。

segments.en: Yeah, so why do you think it's called a Trojan?
segments.cn: 是的，那你觉得为什么叫木马？

segments.en: Probably because of Troy something because it's very difficult like a Trojan.
segments.cn: 可能是因为特洛伊的某些事情，因为它很难像木马一样。

segments.en: Well, think about the story of the Trojan horse, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，想想特洛伊木马的故事，对吧？

segments.en: So back in ancient Greece, there was a war happening and Troy wanted to defeat its enemy and they didn't know how to do it.
segments.cn: 所以在古希腊，有一场战争正在进行，特洛伊想要打败敌人，但他们不知道怎么做。

segments.en: So they thought and thought and thought and they came up with an idea.
segments.cn: 所以他们想了又想，想出了一个主意。

segments.en: They would build a horse and they would give it as a gift.
segments.cn: 他们会建造一匹马，并把它作为礼物送出去。

segments.en: But inside the horse would be warriors, fighters.
segments.cn: 但马里面会有战士，战斗者。

segments.en: So when the city opened its doors to this wonderful gift, they would receive a horrible gift, an attack.
segments.cn: 所以当城市向这个美妙的礼物敞开大门时，他们会收到一个可怕的礼物，一次攻击。

segments.en: And so Trojan is like that.
It's like software that you think is safe, but then it attacks your computer by surprise.
segments.cn: 它就像你认为是安全的软件，但然后它会突然攻击你的电脑。

segments.en: And now things have come up like Trojans and worms and a lot of different names for them.
segments.cn: 现在出现了像木马和蠕虫这样的东西，还有很多不同的名称。

segments.en: But it's crazy now, although I hear Mac users don't have these problems.
segments.cn: 但现在很疯狂，尽管我听说Mac用户没有这些问题。

segments.en: If you use a Macintosh computer, you probably have very few problems with viruses and things like that.
segments.cn: 如果你使用Macintosh电脑，你可能几乎没有病毒和这些问题。

segments.en: Wow, that's one point in favor for Mac users.
segments.cn: 哇，这对Mac用户来说是一个优点。

segments.en: So let us know, have you had problems with a virus on your computer?
segments.cn: 所以让我们知道，你的电脑上有没有病毒问题？

segments.en: Have you ever called tech support?
segments.cn: 你曾经拨打过技术支持吗？

segments.en: We hope to see you there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你。
